description: Web-like structures formed by neutrophils that trap pathogens and sustain inflammation.
A chronic inflammatory bowel disease causing inflammation and ulcers in the digestive tract.
A type of inflammatory bowel disease that can affect any part of the gastrointestinal tract.
A class of medications used to reduce inflammation by inhibiting tumor necrosis factor α.
A pro-inflammatory cytokine involved in inflammatory responses.
Proteins involved in signaling pathways that mediate cellular responses to growth factors and stress.
A chemical used to induce colitis in experimental models.
